review: Do not take this medicine. It’s just another pill doctors can make money off of. I took this for tonsillitis / bacteria in my throat and my legs were in excruciating pain the whole time. It felt like I had blood clots in them. I couldn’t sleep or sit. The only thing that would make the pain go away is when I would walk. I took so much Advil to counteract the pain that I got a stomach ulcer. I felt like the medicine was eating away at my body so I stopped and within 24 hours, the pain went away. I went on a detox because I felt that if I kept taking it, it would damage my nerves. The doctor said that I was crazy but I’ve heard people with similar stories. Take augmentin, amoxicillin, or penicillin. Stick to the classics. This was way too strong and damaging to the body. However, it did get rid of my throat infection in just a few days. But I could’ve taken amoxicillin and it would’ve done the same thing.
Cleocin (clindamycin):I hestitate on rating this medication because the side effects were so bad, I had to discontinue it soon after I  started. I was on it for chronic UTI's

First and foremost, this was my first time ever taking Clindamycin.I had an ear infection and I was on a round of augmentin from 12/19 til 12/29 for a double ear infection and my left ear healed but my right ear did not. Went back to the Dr and was prescribed a 10 day round of Clindamycin - take 4 times a day. I set alarms for myself every 6 hours and I do wake up around 4 or 5 am to take my first dose of the day. I've learned a trick with taking this to avoid the heartburn and side effects. Eat something small, drink 8 ounces of water, take the pill, then eat another small portion and drink another 8 ounces of water! I have YET to have any side effects since doing this. No diarrhea, no upset tummy! Within 48 hours of being on the medication I could tell a difference. 10/10 would recommend. Remember, everyone does different with antibiotics. Don't let 1 horrible review scare you!

I will never use this drug again! I was diagnosed with a cyst and the dr. prescribed me this to prevent any infection it may have caused. I was supposed to use this drug 3x a day for 10 days and had to stop after day 3. This medicine made my hair fall out near my hairline!!!! (I'm a woman with a full head of hair mind you). It was noticeably balding. TERRIBLE TERRIBLE DRUG. Stay away if you can.

I have pretty good teeth but my very back right tooth got decayed and I ended up with an abscess.  The abscess spread into a radiating pain into my right jaw bone, right ear, and upper right back teeth.  It was debilitating. I ended up at the walk-in clinic and the emergency room it was so severe. I finally found a combo that worked for me to make the pain manageable until I could see a dentist and clindamycin 3 time a day was CRUCIAL to my treatment. If I didn’t take my clindamycin I couldn’t find relief. Until I saw the dentist and got the tooth completely pulled out in the back the infection never went away. However if you have a debilitating tooth abscess that’s spread and is causing you to literally lose sleep, and wake up in immense pain then clindamycin is a lifesaver until you can get dental care to get rid of your abscess. It’s very important to note that you do not need to lay down after taking clindamycin for at least 30 minutes and drink TONS of water

Been a life long IBS sufferer 20 years I took clindamycin for an infection of some type and it did wonders for my bowels. I felt better and 20 years later still has that amazing effect. My doctors do not want to prescribe it and for many people this medicine causes bad side affects. For what ever reason this antibiotic does absolute wonders for me and lasts for about 4 months of normal bowel activity. When not on it my IBS holds me hostage to a life that totally sucks. The gut is still the final frontier in terms of understanding it but this has done me wonders. I am only posting here in case anyone had similiar results. On another IBS post a few people said they had similiar results as me. Good luck everyone. Usual dosage 300 mg 3 x a day for 10 days

I was given this as a preventative for some minor cosmetic surgery, only 4 days. I didn't get any major side effects as you will see here, but still feel like rubbish 4 days after stopping. I was in the ER because my leg was slightly swollen as was one of my toes.  My doctor told me to go get a doppler to look for a blood clot.  I was there for 8 hours. They did a doppler and found no blood clots.  My leg is not red, only a little swollen by about 3/4 inch the toe also has slight swelling.  They found my WBC count elevated at 16.5. Since I am allergic to penicillin they told me to take this horrible drug which is incredibly powerful.  There was no rationale to it. I am having the worse cramping and pains.  I will probably stop taking it.

I'm on my second course of clindamycin for a dental infection I cannot have addressed for another 3 weeks or so due to appointment availability with the oral surgeon.  The first course was back a couple months ago and it knocked the infection down to the point that my toothache abated.  Then, six weeks went by and the infection and the nasty toothache came back.  I got my clindamycin script refilled and started another course yesterday morning.  Already, 30 hours later, my toothache is almost gone and I'm pretty much back to normal.   So, it really works...  Like a lot of antibiotics though, clindamycin messes up the bacterial balance in my stomach and I feel like I swallowed an anvil for the first few hours after a dose.  But this passes and, anyway, it is a lot better than the toothache, which was a real doozy.  I'll be glad when its over and the bad teeth are gone and I get my new permanent bridge, though.

I was prescribed Clindamycin three times for a severe gum infection. I took probiotics along with it, always recommended with an antibiotic, and the gum infection finally cleared up. Amoxicillin did nothing.

Was prescribed this drug to clear up a mild case of skin infection on my foot. I'll be honest, I was absolutely TERRIFIED to take this drug after reading the horrific reviews on this site and many others. Took 4 pills a day 300mg for 1 week with absolutely no issues. Worst I experienced was a foul taste in my mouth and mild heartburn when I forgot to eat my yogurt and drink sufficient water for that day. Ate before each pill and took at least 2 small cups of yogurt each day and before dosage. Infection cleared up pretty well and has faded from the rich purple color it was from before taking the medicine. Don't be fooled by the negative reviews on this drug, just make sure to drink with a FULL glass of water and have something in your stomach before taking the pill. Also, be sure to wait at least 30 min to an hour before lying down after taking the pill to avoid heartburn. Having a probiotic works wonders with this drug in my opinion.

I’ve had several bouts of painful cellulitis, and short of being hospitalised and going on stronger I/V drugs, Clindamycin has Eventually brought my infection under control but this time it has taken a while longer. I don’t seem to have any side effects other than a slightly unpleasant taste In my mouth, which I haven’t experienced other times. I’ve taken with and without food with no discernible difference. Am taking a probiotic concurrently and drinking plenty of water. I guess side effects etc differ for each person and you just have to see what works for you.

I've come to realise all antibiotics produce some side effects. I had a tooth infection (serious pain). Was prescribed this clindamycin for 7 days. It took 3 days to properly kick in and reduce the pain. After the week no pain.Tips. Water, big glass with the pill and try and drink water throughout the day. I don't do fizzy or sweet drinks. I suspect this is where people have trouble.Food seemed to help. I would take on empty stomach in the morning go for a walk with the dog for a couple of hours then eat. Then later in the day take before eating . Food seemed to help settle the nausea.Nausea - yeah all the timeMetallic taste - yep all the timeStand up - don't take lying down, and wash down with a full glass of water (as per instructions) - else it can cause esophagus burnsI didn’t have stomach cramps etc. Just felt a bit sick and bloated. No where near all the ‘terrible’ reviews you will see here. Just be sensible with your diet and follow the instructions! Water, water, water. Bland food.

Clindamycin is a very relevant drug as are its side effects.  Knowing the side effects and how to combat them helps.  Clindamycin is a strong antibiotic in relation to what dentists usually prescribe.  It is usually given to eliminate infection fast.  If you don't feel this is the case, ASK your dentist.  Other options: penicillin, amoxicillin & augmentin.  Eating before antibiotics is far better than trying to eat something after you feel awful.  I can't preach probiotics enough & live culture yogurt, especially for women.  Heartburn can be rough once its set in.  Taking Prilosec ahead and combating residual with a fast acting OTC antacid is usually best.  Remember, just because your doctor prescribed this doesn't mean they know all of its side effects.  That's not their job, its the pharmacist's.  So educate, ask questions and don't be afraid to ask for something different. I got stung by a wasp and got a terrible secondary infection.  The clindamycin cleared up the infection, but the heartburn and stomach ache I got as a result was almost worse than the infection.  I had to constantly take Tums and Pepto-Bismol to fight off the nausea and heartburn.
Cleocin (clindamycin):Absolute best antibiotic for a tooth infection. Took as prescribed and pain was gone in 24 hours on a graduated scale. Pain was bearable within 12 hours with no pain killers.

I'll be honest, I read the leaflet and still went ahead and lied down after 5-10 of having taken the pill. The first 7 days it didn't seem to bother me much, but now I'm feeling a hint of heartburn. The medication kicked my dental abscess!Great pill, but don't be like me, a dummy, and put little stock into the warnings. Take it properly!

This medicine gave me SEVERE heartburn immediately after taking the first 2 pills.  I thought it was the spaghetti, but figured out it was the medicine after the heartburn getting worse every time I took it.  I never ever have heartburn or acid reflux, but this medicine caused me unbearable pain and discomfort.  It's just been awful.  It's been a full day since I stopped taking it, but I'm still having some reflux, but that's nothing compared to how sore my throat is.  I can't swallow, eat, or drink without terrible pain.
This medicine has crazy side effects. I have MRSA so I am on 300Mg 4x daily. The heartburn is a 10 (1-10) level of discomfort. I take a Pearl probiotic daily.
Prescribed after a root canal.  After taking this for a week, I also started getting unbearable heartburn.  I wasn't aware of the "don't lie down" warning.

Am on Clindamycin for abscessed tooth. Was fine the first 4 days however now I'm having heartburn/extreme pressure in throat. Feels like I've swallowed something warm that got stuck and just won't leave. Seemed to help the infection however. I'll be calling my doc on Monday if this continues; absolutely horrible sensation.

After reading many bad reviews of clindamycin I was skeptical of taking it. I generally have a sensitive stomach and don't react well with medication that must be taken with food (metrodinazole made me so sick an disoriented I couldn't work). I am VERY pleased with the results. I am taking 150mg for a root canal that infected. I take extra precaution as my stomach can be sensitive. I drink a full bottle of water and eat more than just a snack every time I take a pill. I wait at least 45 minutes before laying down after taking it. So far I have not had ANY major issues. I am on day 7 and the only side effects I have experienced are some very minor heartburn and some gas in the late evening. The swelling had gone completely by the fourth day

I took clindamycin for 8 days every 6 hours for my tooth infection after amoxicillin failed. I was very concerned at first after I heard about the severe side effects and the fact that I have a very sensitive stomach and had bad reaction to antibiotics before.Here is what prevented any bad side effects: I took one capsule every six hours, even at night, ALWAYS with food and ALWAYS with a 16oz. glass of water. After that I DID NOT lay down for at least 30 minutes. Most importantly I took probiotics (from the fridge in the health food store) three times a day, two hours after my clindamycin dose. I had minor nausea occasionally, and looser stool but both weren't bothersome at all. It cleared the infection within a week and I would recommend.

This has been the most wonderful medicine for my 2 abscessed teeth. Yes both hit me at one time and it was very very painful and within 36 hours of taking it I could see a big difference such as less pain and decreased swelling. This is day 6 and I have no pain and no swelling.

On the third day of taking it I woke up with heartburn and felt awful the entire day. Headache, feverish, nausea, and aches. I stopped taking the medicine and will not take it again. I have not taken a pill since Sunday night at 10:30pm. It's Tuesday morning and I still have heartburn.
I took this medicine prior to tooth extraction. After one day I got diarrhea and has been this way for two weeks now.

I had a toothache and went to the doctor who gave me penicillin, which didn't work. My face blew up and was extremely sore. I went back after 3 days on that it and the dentist gave me clindamycin. Got to say it is killing the infection and the pain is much less. As well as the swelling, the only problem I have had is the horrible taste that keeps coming up the back of my throat. Not like heartburn though because there is no pain.. just a nasty bitter taste. I'm still mid course so I hope the rest goes smoothly.

Took for Root Canal and tooth infection.  Take with water and most likely after eating.  If chest pains and/or heartburn I found Alkaseltzer worked the best and fastest.  Also try the live culture yogurt and foods high in fiber.

So glad I found this site. I am suffering so badly with awful heartburn, took a pill and lay down, WRONG! Didn't know about the warning to not lay down for 30 mins until I read it here. Thought I was having a heart attack or something. Hopefully it goes away soon, awful pain.

Clindamycin (300 MG 4 x a day for 2  weeks) was prescribed for a very serious staph infection in my knee/bursitis. The pain and swelling began subsiding within 36 hours. Should be taken with a lot of water. Side effects include a little heartburn after taking the pills and a mild vaginal infection after 2 weeks, so lots of yogurt should be eaten to avoid this infection.

I have been in and out of the hospital 6 times in the last year.  Clindamycin is always prescribed. (I have ongoing staphylococcus , streptococcus and cellulitus).  WARNING!  NEVER EVER lay down after taking this medicine.  It will hurt. Drink LOTS of water and get ready for diarrhea.  It does its job.

This medicine has relieved all of my pain in 24 hours at 300mg 3 times daily. The heartburn is very real and somewhat unpleasant. Antacids are not doing a lot. I did not lay down, but sitting still isn't a great idea either. This medicine is doing its job so unless the infection comes back I would say it is worth the heartburn.

I just started taking clindamycin (300MG 3x's a day) for a throat infection and so far it has began to take the pain away, but being a diabetic, for some reason my blood sugar has sky-rocketed. Also, pay CLOSE ATTENTION to the directions. I did not drink enough water with taking it and lay down right after and I got a really bad feeling in my esophagus and chest. Silly me. Take plenty of water with this antibiotic, the feeling of a pill being stuck in your throat is not pleasant. And for diabetics, monitor your blood sugar closely.
This is a great medication as it cures infections, however it causes severe heartburn and chest discomfort. Drink at least 8 oz of water and do not lay down within 30 minutes of taking it!
Have been taking for 5 days now at the maximum dosage for a tooth infection. No relief from the pain and all I've experienced is terrible heartburn.

I was prescribed this medication for a tooth infection - 300mg 4 x day starting with a double dose as soon as I got the home. The night I took the first 2 pills, I immediately had several bouts of diarrhea. The next day when I moved down to 1 pill 4 x daily, I had more normal bowel motions. I did however stupidly take close to bedtime and without heeding the warning re: laying down. I woke up with the worst heartburn/chest pain. I just finished my pills and look forward to no more heartburn.

I had a gum infection that got so bad that my face swelled up and was red and hot to the touch.  My dentist put me on clindamycin 3 times a day (4 times a day for the first 2 days), this did clear up the infection (was on it for 2 weeks) then was able to have the surgery needed (had to wait for the infection to disappear first), then had to stay on it for 5 days after surgery to prevent infection. I had to stop after 4 days, my heartburn and indigestion was so bad and have had black stools for past three days, going to wait to see if everything clears up after stopping medication. I haven't taken it since yesterday morning, I haven't had heartburn since yesterday afternoon.

I have been taking 300 mg 2 tablets, 3 x a day for four days now for an abscess on my lower leg. I haven't experienced any major side effects but I also take it with at least a cup and a half of water and I have eaten about 4 cups of yogurt a day too.  They told me that yogurt would help any yeast infection that I might get from the antibiotics. So far so good.. no heartburn, no nothing except that the swelling and redness are now gone! I still have 3 days to go, but I give this antibiotic a thumbs up!

Let me just say this about this medicine. DO NOT LIE DOWN FOR AT LEAST 20-40 MINUTES AFTER TAKING DOSE! I just did like a half hour ago and I am regretting it.  I started taking the Clinamycin for a very nasty, very large abscess that took up a huge portion of the roof of my mouth.  The infection started in the tooth to the right of my right front tooth.  The pain was UNBEARABLE.  I've been taking the medicine since Wednesday night (5 days ago) and I haven't had the problems that I've had with Penicillin (nausea, twitching, hunger pains that don't stop). But I ignored the warning and lay down.  So much burning in my chest! I hope it goes away soon.  It's so weird!

No noticeable adverse effects despite allergy to penicillin.  Works well for me, and quickly. Have taken with food, without food, sleeping immediately after, with no more severe issues than mild heartburn.

I would have to say this is the most powerful antibiotic I have used for a abscess. I have a shot in the butt and as soon as she started to inject the medicine my abscess popped. I have been taking the pills for a day now and I have had heartburn (which I have never had before), but I think the heartburn is better than having an infection or an abscess.

I took this drug for two abscesses. After 48 hours my pain was bearable after the recommended 6 day course (4 x's daily at 150mg) it took care of the infections.  I did experience heartburn and diarrhea 1 day.  Took probiotics to try to counter all the bacteria in my body being destroyed.  On the second full day of taking clindamycin I did experience terrible joint pain in my arms and legs and felt very uncomfortable but that subsided after a good nights sleep.  Overall I liked the fact that it took care of the infection but am always leery of the side effects and what they can do in the long run. I strongly recommend taking probiotics or a good homemade kefir or yogurt product during and after treatment, take 2-3 hOUrs after each dose.

I seem to be the only one who reacted to this stuff with noticeable chest soreness- not really cramps and thank goodness no vomiting, but my chest feels all sore. And, especially at night, I also feel rather out of breath. The prescription was for a rather severe infection from a root canal. Said infection made my entire upper lip swell up completely, was so painful and sensitive that I was popping Ibuprofen along with Tylenol every six hours, every day, for several days. Clindamycin probably had some effect, but what really made a difference was a specialist physically draining the infection. Otherwise it wasn't going down.

I HAVE PAIN IN MY FRONT TOOTH NERVE. I STARTED TAKING THIS DRUG TO HELP WITH INFECTION AND AFTER 2 DAYS, WHILE TAKING THIS PILL 4 TIMES A DAY I WAS RELIEVED BY ALL PAIN. THIS IS A GREAT DRUG, very powerful.
Good medicine for the infection.
My stomach feels like it is going to pop.  I don't feel like eating because I am so bloated.  Just trying to get through the last 2 days.  It did stop my toothache!

The prescription bottle indicates this can cause colitis. It can cause Colitis months after taking it. The alternative is, what - dying of terminal tooth infection? I can only hope that little cup of water I take, before sitting upright for 40 minutes will prevent my duodenal from getting uppity.
I take prior to dental appointments. I have never had a reaction or negative symptoms.

I had a root canal 2 weeks ago, and there was no abscess or infection then. After the second part of the root canal a couple days ago, the x-ray showed an infection. Since I'm allergic to penicillin, they prescribed clindamycin. I have a sensitive stomach, and this medicine really did a number on me! I took 3 capsules 8 hours apart, and each one had worse results. I also forgot about not lying down for 30 minutes after taking a pill the 3rd time. I filled my stomach up with food to try and protect it, but it didn't work. I had nausea, stomach pain, and intestinal cramps. I have no idea if it would have cleared the infection. I just started taking cephalexin tonight, which can also cause stomach problems, but so far it hasn't.

I was prescribed clindamycin 8 days ago as a result of an extraction of two roots in a molar. The other root remained so the dentist can do a root canal to keep the tooth for a bridge. I developed a bad infection. My face became swollen, red and inflamed. I was taking clindamycin 3x a day 500 mg. Almost all better except for jaw spasms. The only problem I had was last night. I took the pill with a sip of water and went to sleep. Bad mistake. I didn't know you should not lay down for 30 minutes and to drink 8 oz with it each time taken. I woke up with the worst heartburn ever in my life. Antacids didn't work at all. Had to take pepto bismol. It helped. It still hurts when I swallow but better. Warning: sit up for 30 min & drink h20

I was prescribed Clindamycin in a hospital emergency room for a bacterial infection (cellulitis) in my lower leg and was on it for only about 36 hours (six 300 mg doses).  I experienced a severe headache and began experiencing diarrhea.  I called my doctor and asked for a different medication because I have to work and couldn't while experiencing diarrhea.  My doctor put me on metronidazole (500 mg) 3 times a day.I've been off of Clindamycin for 11 days today and am still experiencing mild diarrhea, depression, anxiety, and shortness of breath.

I have a molar abscess. After taking Clindamycin 150 mg an hour ago, I was awakened by severe burning pain in my chest.  I called the pharmacist who told me to take two antacids. I already ate a little yogurt and bread with butter. I didn't know that this medicine should be taken with a full glass of water and not to lie down for 30 minutes after taking it.
SEVERE allergic reaction, rash all over my face after 6 days of this-  itching, red, swollen, peeling, looks like the worst acne you ever saw with a sunburn on top.
This medicine caused very severe heartburn.  Also very sick to the stomach.

I used this drug for root canal abscess. It took me 10 days to reduce the pain coming from my lymph nodes. I actually never feel pain in my tooth. I had black/grey color stool, and feel a little rush and feel of chest, when I breath. Obviously this medication is very strong for me.
I had a severe case of cellulitis and was prescribed 325mg of clindamycin. No results.

I am taking Clindaycin now and I get a dry throat, seemed to have gained a little more weight because of being hungry, but I do believe it has cleared the infection (absessed tooth). I imagine when I'm done with my course everything will be back to normal hopefully. I'd recommend it.

I used the 150mg capsule for a severe tooth abscess/infection that was painful and extremely inflamed. After only 36 hours of treatment, the infection began to subside and the pain level dropped drastically. This medicine performed very well and I would suggest it to someone else.
This is good for a tooth abscess.
At first it made my tooth infection feel better but before I finished my whole course of the antibiotic I had a severe reaction to it. I had a high fever and painful sore throat.

While this drug worked very well to treat a gum infection, it gave me a terrible rash on my back and chest two days after finishing my course. Allergic reaction I guess. I am also allergic to penicillin.

It started halfway through the prescription, had trouble swallowing pills and water. Thought it was just me. By the time I was done with the script I had severe heartburn and acid reflux. I couldn't eat anything because it would upset my stomach. This medicine inflamed my esophagus, that's why I had trouble swallowing. The doctor put me on Protonix to repair it.
This stuff gave me the worst chest pains and such bad heartburn

I found that of all the penicilin-type medications I've ever used, this one gave me little to no stomach upset or that gnawing always hungry feeling. Diarrhea, yes, and some skin irritation. Overall a very positive experience.
Cleocin (clindamycin):Used two two-week rounds of Cleocin for an abcess. While I had diarrhea the entire time, there is surely not a better drug to bring relief to a staph infection.
